post.author: Site Admin
post.content:
By Stephen Shankland Staff Writer, CNET News.com February 26, 2001, 12:00 p.m. PT

Sun Microsystems has released a test version of a new "connector" software module for its server version of Java, the company announced Monday. The beta version of the connector software allows heavy-duty business programs, such as SAP's R/3, to connect to Java 2 Enterprise Edition 1.3 software. J2EE, which 25 companies have licensed from Sun, is used chiefly to run complicated e commerce sites. The software provides a standard way to take advantage of server software such as e-mail or databases.
post.title: Sun releases "connector" beta
